Package network

Class NetworkMessageParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • network.NetworkMessageParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public abstract class NetworkMessageParser
extends java.lang.Thread
    An abstract class that defines the interface of a NetworkMessageParser. It inherits from Thread and therefore is runnable in its own thread. This class is made to handle and parse data from a single associated client.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Arthur Depasse
    See Also:
    NetworkSSLServer, FSMServer

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

      Fields

      protected FSMServer fsm
      The fsm associated with this parser
      protected java.io.DataInputStream input
      The DataInputSTream that is linked with the clients socket
      protected java.util.concurrent.Semaphore mutex
      The mutex shared with the FSM on the currentState.
      protected java.util.UUID originId
      The UUID associated with the client.
      boolean running
      A boolean to know whether or not this parser is running.

        The fsm associated with this parser

      • mutex

        protected java.util.concurrent.Semaphore mutex
        The mutex shared with the FSM on the currentState. It prevents the parser to read it while the FSM is modifying it.
        See Also:
        getMutex()

        public boolean running
        A boolean to know whether or not this parser is running.

      • parse

        public abstract void parse​(java.lang.String currentState)
        An abstract function that does the actual parsing in regard of the currentState of the machine. It must be redefined by the users.
        Parameters:
        currentState - the current state of the FSM

      • run

        public void run()
        The run method of the Thread, it is responsible for fetching the currentState and passing it on to the parser while the thread is running.
